scopus_products.abstract: Recently, a new theory concerning the spurious free approximation of electromagnetic eigenproblems has appeared, which is in contrast with the one currently accepted in the electromagnetic community. To stress the need to adopt the new theory, we show that in two simple cases, spurious modes appear, even though the conditions on which the old and accepted theory is based are satisfied. On the contrary, none of these cases conflicts with the new theory. A new and more subdolous behavior of spurious modes is also pointed out.

scopus_products.title: On the convergence of galerkin finite element approximations of electromagnetic eigenproblems
scopus_products.venue: SIAM Journal on Numerical Analysis
scopus_products.authors: Caorsi Salvatore; Fernandes Paolo; Raffetto Mirco
scopus_products.keywords: Convergence | Discontinuous material properties | Edge elements | Electromagnetic eigenproblems | Galerkin finite element approximations | Noncompact operators | Spurious modes
scopus_products.abstract: The convergence of Galerkin finite element approximations of electromagnetic eigenproblems modelling cavity resonators is studied. Since the operator involved is noncompact, the first part of the analysis is carried out in terms of the specific definition of convergence that is known to be appropriate for this case. Then, a slightly stronger definition of convergence is proposed, which is tuned to the features a practitioner of the numerical simulation of electromagnetic devices requires for a good computational model of a resonant cavity. For both definitions, necessary and sufficient conditions are introduced and discussed. Moreover, it is proved that the convergence of an approximation in the stronger sense is unaffected by the presence of different materials filling the cavity resonator. Exploiting this basic feature of the newly defined convergence, the previously developed theory is applied to generalize the convergence proof for the lowest order edge element approximations to the case of anisotropic, inhomogeneous and discontinuous material properties. Results clarifying the relationships among the various conditions occurring in our analysis and examples showing what may happen when not all the conditions for convergence hold true are also reported and contribute to a clear picture about the origin and the behavior of spurious modes.

scopus_products.title: Spurious-free approximations of electromagnetic eigenproblems by means of Nedelec-type elements
scopus_products.venue: Mathematical Modelling and Numerical Analysis
scopus_products.authors: Caorsi Salvatore; Fernandes Paolo; Raffetto Mirco
scopus_products.keywords: Convergence | Discontinuous material properties | Discrete compactness | Electromagnetic eigenproblems | Galerkin finite element approximations | Mixed boundary conditions | New families of edge elements | Spurious modes | Symmetry exploitation
scopus_products.abstract: By using an inductive procedure we prove that the Galerkin finite element approximations of electromagnetic eigenproblems modelling cavity resonators by elements of any fixed order of either Nedelec's edge element family on tetrahedral meshes are convergent and free of spurious solutions. This result is not new but is proved under weaker hypotheses, which are fulfilled in most of engineering applications. The method of the proof is new, instead, and shows how families of spurious-free elements can be systematically constructed. The tools here developed are used to define a new family of spurious-free edge elements which, in some sense, are complementary to those defined in 1986 by Nedelec.

By means of some examples, concerning dielectric cylinders either in free space or buried in a lossy half space, we point out the dependence of the object localization on the spatial sampling rate of the scattered electric field and its relation to the field spatial bandwidth.

scopus_products.venue: European Congress on Computational Methods in Applied Sciences and Engineering Eccomas 2000

scopus_products.keywords: Cavity resonators | Convergence of spectral approximations | Electromagnetic eigenproblems | Galerkin finite element approximations | Nedelec's edge elements | Spurious modes
scopus_products.abstract: A comprehensive theory explaining the origin and the behaviour of spurious solutions in Galerkin finite element approximation of electromagnetic eigenproblems modelling cavity resonators is reported. This theory holds under very general assumptions allowing inhomogeneous, anisotropic and discontinuous material properties, topologically nontrivial problem domains and mixed boundary conditions arising from symmetry exploitation. A precise definition of spurious-free approximation is proposed and conditions necessary and sufficient to obtain an approximation which is spurious-free in the sense just defined are given. The spurious-free character of an approximation proves to be independent from the properties of materials possibly filling the cavity resonator. Hence, it is sufficient to prove it for an empty cavity and the result immediately carry over the case in which the same cavity is loaded in a general way. This is very helpful since, at present, none of the known convergence proofs still hold when discontinuous material properties are assumed. © ECCOMAS.

Many numerical results concerning the scattering cross section per unit length are provided and, where possible, they are compared with already available results. We consider only perpendicular incidence, although oblique generalization is conceptually easy.

scopus_products.abstract: In this paper, the uniqueness of the solution of electromagnetic boundary-value problems is investigated and, in some cases, proven. scopus_products.abstract: A solution to the electromagnetic scattering of a transverse magnetic plane wave due to a perfectly conducting elliptic cylinder coated by a lossless, nonmagnetic, and elliptic multilayer dielectric is proposed. An outline of the procedure is given, and some numerical results, concerning both the field quantities and the radar cross section per unit length, are provided.

Thus, in this context, numerical scattering simulators are becoming more and more important. scopus_products.abstract: The knowledge: o f the electromagnetic source and of the complex dielectric permittivity distributions of a model of human head does not allow the exact evaluation of the field strength and of the power deposition inside a particular human head, as a consequence of the differences between the model considered and the actual head. The problem is even worse considering that each man has a different head configuration. In order to point out this difficulty we consider some simple models of the human head and, by modifying some dielectric or geometric parameters, we show that the computed electromagnetic field can have big variations. On the basis of these results, we suggest an alternative way to predict the internal field, i.e., the use of a microwave-imaging technique. In particular, a probabilistic approach to the solution of the complete nonlinear formulation of the related inverse scattering problem is considered.

scopus_products.title: On the effect of the spurious modes in deterministic problems
scopus_products.venue: COMPEL the International Journal for Computation and Mathematics in Electrical and Electronic Engineering
scopus_products.authors: Caorsi S.; Fernandes P.; Raffetto M.
scopus_products.abstract: It is well known that spurious modes not satisfying Maxwell's equations, not even approximately, often appear among the finite element solutions of electromagnetic eigenproblems. In the present work a theoretical investigation is carried out about the way these spurious modes may affect the solution of deterministic problems. The following result is obtained: in order to properly approximate a deterministic problem, a finite element method must be such that, when applied to the corresponding eigenproblem, it confines the spurious modes at zero frequency but does not eliminate them. In fact, though improper excitation of spurious modes is to be avoided, nevertheless, they are unexpectedly required, in general, to approximate the solution of a deterministic problem.

scopus_products.title: Hybrid finite-element numerical approach to the solution of electromagnetic scattering problem
scopus_products.venue: COMPEL the International Journal for Computation and Mathematics in Electrical and Electronic Engineering
scopus_products.authors: Caorsi S.; Massa A.; Raffetto M.
scopus_products.abstract: This paper analyses a numerical approach to solving electromagnetic scattering problems involving three-dimensional, inhomogeneous, dielectric objects. The considered technique, combines the Moment Method (MoM) and the Finite Element Method (FEM) to evaluate the electromagnetic scattering for penetrable bodies. In essence, an equivalence principle is invoked to divide the original problem into two separate problems (interior and exterior problem) which are then coupled by enforcing the continuity of the tangential components of the electric and magnetic fields. The interior problem related to the dielectric body is dealt with FEM method (version with edge-element to eliminate the spurious mode) and the exterior problem is addressed by the MoM method. A matrix equation is obtained whose unknowns are the equivalent current sources associated with such problems. Finally, the system of equations obtained can be solved by classical algorithms or pseudo-inversion techniques. Numerical investigations have been performed to analyse the validity and the efficiency of this formulation by considering canonical dielectric geometries and by comparing the achieved solutions with analytical solutions and with results yielded by other numerical methods.
